  Compatibility define for APOXI_2.9.0

Detailed Description

Defines to establish backward compatibility in source code

Per default classes or methods in APOXI which have been marked as obsolete are disabled to reduce the code size. If applications still use obsolete classes, the COMPAT defines allow to stay backward compatible by turning on the obsolete methods.

Additionally when using one compatibility define it is recommended to use all succeeding compatibility defines, because of the dependencies that may arise with the reanimated code.

Example: If the version APOXI_1.13.0 is used and the applications require some methods from APOXI_1.12.0 which have been marked as obsolete in APOXI_1.13.0 the define APOXI_COMPAT_1_12_0 must be set. If a higher version than APOXI_1.13.0 is used (e. g. APOXI_2.2.0) also the missing COMPAT-defines between must be enabled. This means for APOXI_2.2.0 that the defines APOXI_COMPAT_1_13_0, APOXI_COMPAT_2_0_0 and APOXI_COMPAT_2_1_0 must be enabled additionally to APOXI_COMPAT_1_12_0. This is because the obsolete methods from APOXI_1.12.0 might require the obsolete methods from APOXI_1.13.0, APOXI_2.0.0 or APOXI_2.1.0.

Note: Enabling compatibility defines should only be a temporary situation in a project. It must be the goal to every application to run without the usage of obsoleted code.

Define Documentation

#define APOXI_COMPAT_1_11_0
 

Compatibility define for APOXI_1.11.0

This define enables backward compatibility to the version APOXI_1.11.0. All the functionality of APOXI_1.11.0 which is supposed to be obsolete in the subsequent versions are reactivated by using this COMPAT define.


Define dependencies:

  • APOXI_COMPAT_1_12_0
  • APOXI_COMPAT_1_13_0
  • APOXI_COMPAT_2_0_0
  • APOXI_COMPAT_2_1_0
  • APOXI_COMPAT_2_2_0
  • APOXI_COMPAT_2_3_0
  • APOXI_COMPAT_2_4_0
  • APOXI_COMPAT_2_6_0
  • APOXI_COMPAT_2_7_0
  • APOXI_COMPAT_2_8_0
  • APOXI_COMPAT_2_9_0
